caption: Great and innovative cafe. The food is incredible, healthy and inspiring. The staff is so friendly and the vibes are comfortable with plenty of seating, indoor and outdoor.  I loved the jacks bowl and the Bahn mi. It was fresh and tasty. I do wish the portions were a bit bigger for the cost, or the entrees came with a side, but overall incredible food.  Dessert, definitely try the rice crispy treat with poppy seeds, so delicious ü§§

We visited Paris recently and ate here twice in the evenings. My wife is gluten-free, and we are both vegetarian. We found this chain online from a list of gluten-free patisserie and restaurants, and it didn't disappoint. The first evening, we had the Wild Burger with the coleslaw side, which was delicious. We also took away some cakes for later. The second evening, we had the Soupe du Jour and Wild Nuggets, which were again delicious. Fast friendly services, a lovely interior decor, and wifi.

If you like or need gluten free food then this is a must. Great location and ambience too. Especially outside - when there's no construction though. Was there when there was construction across the street and it was... LOUD. Not heard when inside the resto though but the weather was so nice so we just stuck it out.

The food was amazing: completely gluten free and decent vegan options. The burger and the cake were yum. The golden latte tasted really good as well. The reason for the atmosphere rated 3 because of the couch/cushioned chair. It needs a wash.

I really enjoyed my meal here! The Jack‚Äôs Bowl was really great and combined so many flavors to form a really well-rounded dish. As a vegetarian, sometimes I feel like I‚Äôm missing out on food like this so this was a great experience. The bowl was ‚Ç¨12.5 which for the area seemed really fair. I loved how everything on the menu was both vegan and gluten free. The staff were really friendly and patient when I spoke to them in English. I would definitely come again!
Nice place to sit and do some work. Smoothies were delicious would buy many if they weren't so pricey... Cookies were delicious but very small for the price. The Bounty was lush.

Ever since I came to Paris I was looking something healthy vegetarian option and OMG found this cafe! Fresh, healthy, a lot to choose from and decently priced. The quantity was good and the food was delicious ü§§ Now this is my Go-to place for the rest of my trip! And the great part, since I don't even eat Vegan meat, the staff was very kind enough to remove it from my dishes and made them custom :)
Had some nice little sweets for breakfast. But there's also other things for lunch/dinner. Quiet and cosy, friendly staff ü•∞  Pros: Choice of foods, Friendliness of service, Atmosphere
Amazing breakfast bowls and drinks. Love the vibe and friendly staff. Only downside is the noisy construction side outside, yet it's still enjoyable to sit outside and eat.

Absolutely love this place! There‚Äôs plenty of room if you need to get work done or just relax! It was really nice that they had outdoor seating too, and the fact that they have options that are gluten-free vegan and vegetarian is a major plus!

Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt have a good experience today. I really lot the brand and always when I have the opportunity I go to the restaurant but today I did not have a good time there. The a√ßai was good, but the service was not as good as it. I asked her multiple times for the points in my account and I still not receive.
Great spot for healthy food + high protein options but careful it gets super crowded on the weekends, the quality/ quantity is not always consistent amongst outlets. Nonetheless I love their shakes!

Casual order-at-the-counter vegan eatery with tasty plant-based foods ranging from curry bowls to sandwiches to smoothies and juices. Located right near lots of high end shopping. Staff was friendly and helpful. Ordered a curry and the Jack‚Äôs Bowl, both were very tasty, healthy, and came out nearly right away.
good vibes. a bit expensive, but that's the trend. let's hope there are more and more vegan restaurants in the world

I recently had the pleasure of dining at this establishment, and I must say, it was an exquisite experience. The extensive selection of vegan and gluten-free dishes showcased the restaurant's commitment to accommodating various dietary preferences. The staff, with their impeccable courtesy and attentiveness, elevated the overall dining experience. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone in search of delectable cuisine within an inviting and sophisticated ambiance.

Nice vegan&gluten free place in Central Paris üòä I ordered a wild cheese burger and Chocolate Chaga, the burger was very nice - juicy and full of flavour. However the bun was a little bit too small and half of my burger ended up on a plate ü•≤ Chocolate Chaga (hot chocolate) was very disappointing for me since I like sweet things and this one was veeeeery watery and had a bitter taste (almost no flavour honestly) I think I should‚Äôve ordered smoothie üòÜ But I like the concept a lot - cool names, even WiFi password and table numbers are creative, a lot of place to seat and charge your phone, you have privacy and the toilet is big and clean. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre vegan

I wish you were in London too! üòç I ordered a Jacks bowl and the protein was so well seasoned. It was a great meal. We finished it with a mushroom latte and a protein slice and everything was honestly so delicious. The prices are very fair for where you are and what you get too. The staff were very helpful (assured me everyone spoke English) and they guided us through the whole process.

Super small serving sizes and overpriced for what you get! Staff were pretty unfriendly and forgot our hot drink until we asked for it when we‚Äôd almost finished our food. it was very disappointing as I get really excited to see fully plant based restaurants when I‚Äôm travelling. Better customer service skills could make a huge difference!  Had the porridge, smoothie bowl and hot chocolate! Only gave the extra star because the hot chocolate flavour was great

Amazing location for this beautiful coffee shop. Choose to sit outside and enjoy your morning coffe under the shadow of the trees. There are plenty of sweet and savory options. Coffee was tasty and the sweets that I ate were delicious, the savory (feta ball) not so much. There are a plethora of juices to choose and some morning deserts with chia seeds. The service was great and the girl at the counter spoke perfect English.

Delicious food and drinks! Highly recommended! There are many offerings, all of which I prefer to taste. I ordered one of the superbowls. This one was great, with delicious fresh fruit and granola. After this, I also tried 2 small desserts because I couldn't resist them by the looks. The rice crispy and wild bounty were absolutely perfect. The music playing created a great vibe.

Wild & The Moon is my go-to spot in Paris, especially for early breakfast meetings. The atmosphere is welcoming and perfect for a productive start to the day. The food is exceptional, offering a wide variety of vegan options that are both delicious and healthy.  The menu features fresh, organic ingredients that cater to a range of dietary preferences. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for a smoothie bowl, a hearty salad, or just a good cup of coffee, Wild & The Moon never disappoints. The quality of the food and the care put into its preparation really stand out.  It‚Äôs undoubtedly one of the best vegan restaurants and cafes in Paris, providing a calm and cozy setting that‚Äôs ideal for both work and relaxation. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a nourishing meal or a quiet place to start the day.
Wild & The Moon is by far the best vegan place to eat in Paris. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming. It has every plate your vegan heart desires. The food and drinks are incredible.

wild & the moon is easily a 15/10, must go place while you‚Äôre in paris!! it‚Äôs my second time eating here, and both times i have been greeted very kindly by the service team, the food is beyond delicious, the atmosphere is top notch and i always feel super welcomed :) not to mention it‚Äôs absolutely stunning and very aesthetically pleasing. it‚Äôs 100% veggie and has many vegan options too! i would highly, highly recommend wild & the moon to everyone! i will for sure be visiting again soon! <3
Coffee and smoothie bowls tasted good, though it was a bit cold and icy. Granola tasted very fresh. Friendly staff. Atmosphere was alright, just the music was quite loud and a bit too much up-tempo.

Our team stopped coming here although it's a 4-min walk from the office and we're no longer taking clients out for a coffee or lunch meetings.  This is because a bunch of very young employees treat this place as their personal bedroom as far as music choices are concern. Loud, totally inappropriate gangsta rap music or techno with strong bass line.  It just feels completely disrespectful of their clients to begin with, whom for the most part are above 40 y/o but mainly it reflects poorly on Wild and the Moon and this kind of music goes against everything their claim they stand for regarding food.

Best vegan restaurant and food in Paris. I love the Wild & The Moon and their locations as well as their staff and dishes. Really tasty and quality ingredients for affordable prices! The decor is so lovely and the atmosphere is great. The music can be too loud, but one can come to study or cowork!

Walking in here felt like a breath of fresh air. Warm and friendly atmosphere. The lady at the counter welcomed us with a smile and was very patient and helpful while we looked through the menu and asked questions. The food was delicious and had lots of healthy options. Definitely recommended!
One of my favourite places in Paris . Beautiful atmosphere, great vegan food . Menu that changes every seasons , everything fresh and delicious! A real heaven for vegans :)

We visited twice during our stay in Paris. Everything is vegan and gluten free so it's perfect for people with dietary restrictions. We really liked the burgers, bowls and sandwiches , but the breakfast porridge was disappointing, really small portion and didn't really taste like anything.

Please turn down the music. We spend 800+ euros a month at your locations and I can no longer eat inside (or outside now that you've taken the outdoor chairs away in all but one location).  When I walk 35 minutes across town to eat vegan, gluten-free food, and I feel like I‚Äôm sitting in the middle of a nightclub with loud gangster rap (love being called a MF hoe in the music), and I can‚Äôt even hear my partner talk at 4 PM in the afternoon on a Sunday, we leave.  The atmosphere you‚Äôre creating is so incongruent with the vibe you are trying to portray. In a world full of noise, it would be wonderful just to be able to have a meal with my partner that is calm where we can hear each other talk and not have our nervous system‚Äôs totally disturbed. You can‚Äôt even enjoy your food. The music is so loud consistently in almost all of the locations.  You have to choose whether you are a caf√© or are you a club because your very young employees are killing the vibe for most of the people who can afford to eat at your restaurant every day like we do, spending ‚Ç¨800+ a month. We don‚Äôt bring our computers for four hours; we come to spend money with our family, and you‚Äôre driving us away.  Please stop letting 21-year-old employees pick the music and crank it up. You're losing more than just our business.

Loved working here with my laptop! Yummy matcha and light bites. Everything gluten free dairy free refined sugar free and organic! So fun. Tons of seating. Free WiFi. Bathroom. Indoor and outdoor places. Not too loud but not quiet. Nice music choices.
Vegans rejoice!!! Loved everything about our experience! Food was delicious, staff was kind and highly efficient and the vibes were on point. Beautiful spot!

Terrible music, all the time you go in they'll have techno or gangsta rap. Employees are in their twenties and they pick music to look cool. It's awful how you cannot enjoy a meal in peace without being assaulted by the music.  It's also starting to feel like WeWork where very young people come and bring their laptop and stay for hours just being one coffee...  Other than thathe food is organic (as it should be in most restaurants honestly when looking at their prices!), the meals are gluten-free yet delicious, made with real ingredients that taste good and are fresh.  No bad oils, fillers, preservatives or added whatever here. Real food as it should be.

Great place for vegans and non vegans as well! Rice crispies are to die for and chai latte delicious as well! I also was there for lunch and they have delicious meals, very healthy! Good music playing too üí´
Amazing acai bowls. Fresh, and so so good. We love this place for breakfast or lunch.  The Blue Bowl is yummy.
Friendly service. Great food.  My son eats vegan and finding good options is a challenge.  It was a great find for us.  We loved it!

This is my favourite WATM location! The music is üî•. It‚Äôs super big. Great for a study session, reading your book, or journaling. Great for Big group catch ups. Love getting a warm drink and snack. Super keen for the summer. Will feel like back home (australia).

Love this place!! There are a few in Paris. Everything is organic, gluten and dairy free. Had breakfast and tried a number of different things. All were good. Also enjoyed the coffee which is not always the case in places like this. Pricy but high quality. Very nice venue and friendly staff. Wifi available.
